Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw different habitats, both on land (like playgrounds or gardens) and in water (like ponds or streams).
The student can illustrate various plants and trees present in each habitat, such as grasses, bushes, and flowering plants.
The student can depict different animals found in each habitat, like lizards, squirrels, and fish.
The student can show how different types of living things are found in different habitats.
The student can use their illustrations to highlight patterns of plant and animal diversity across these habitats.
